questions.question: If another driver tailgates you on a two-lane, two-way road, you should:
choices: Drive on the shoulder to encourage the tailgater to pass
Turn on your emergency flashers to alert the driver behind you
Wait until passing is possible, and then slowly reduce speed

questions.question: The Implied Consent Law means that you:
choices: Are protected from uninsured motorists
Automatically have agreed to be tested for alcohol or drugs in your blood
Can refuse state administered chemical tests

questions.question: By law, headlights must be used:
choices: From a half hour after sunrise until a half hour before sunset
From a half hour after sunset until a half hour before sunrise
From a half hour before sunset until a half hour before sunrise

questions.question: When brakes fail, you should:
choices: Try not to panic
Make a sharp turn to reduce speed
Shift to a higher gear

questions.question: You approach this vehicle from behind. It keeps a low speed. What should you do?
choices: Pass on the left, if safe
Pass on the right
Stay behind since passing is prohibited

questions.question: Stopping suddenly and braking quickly:
choices: Are examples of safe driving
Can cause you to lose control of your vehicle
Help to save fuel

questions.question: When confronted with an aggressive driver (road rage):
choices: Flash your headlights
Honk your horn
Stay out of the way

questions.question: The minimum age that a person must be to obtain an intermediate license is:
choices: 15 1/2 years
14 1/2 years
16 years

questions.question: If there is snow or ice on the road, you should slow down and:
choices: Drive as closely as possible to the center of the road
Follow other vehicles closely to get better traction
Not use your vehicle's cruise control system

questions.question: Whenever you stop your car and go into a store to make a quick purchase, you:
choices: Must stop the engine, but don't need to set the parking brake
Must stop the engine, set the parking brake, and remove the key
Can leave the engine running, but must set the parking brake

questions.question: For an immediate right turn in a roundabout with multiple lanes, you should:
choices: Enter in any lane
Enter in the left lane
Enter in the right lane

questions.question: You should use extra caution when approaching a pedestrian using a white cane because:
choices: He or she is visually impaired
He or she has a walking problem
He or she has impaired hearing

questions.question: You must always stop at a railroad crossing when:
choices: There are more than two tracks
You cannot cross and clear the tracks
Train traffic is frequent

questions.question: To better prepare for the constant decisions necessary for safe, defensive driving, you must:
choices: Follow other vehicles closely
Know what is happening around your vehicle
Drive at least 10 mph below the posted speed limit

questions.question: In this situation (approaching the bicyclist from behind), you should:
choices: Honk your horn to warn the bicyclist
Pass the bicyclist closely and quickly
Slow down and be patient

questions.question: A traffic light with a green arrow means:
choices: You can make a protected turn
All other vehicles are stopped by a red light
Only left turns are permitted at this intersection

questions.question: When you want to pass a motorcycle from behind, you must:
choices: Encourage the motorcycle to move onto the shoulder
Move to another lane before and during the pass
Share the lane, but keep to the left side

questions.question: Yellow or amber flashing lights near the top of a school bus mean:
choices: The bus is about to stop
The bus has just finished loading or unloading children
The bus is loading or unloading children

questions.question: You approach an intersection. Where should you stop if there is a stop sign but no stop line or crosswalk?
choices: Before entering the intersection
You are not required to stop
When you have entered the intersection

questions.question: What should you do during a law enforcement stop?
choices: Signal and pull over to the right
Keep driving until you have all documents ready
Stop quickly and exit your vehicle

questions.question: If you are driving behind a truck or a bus and cannot see the driver in his or her rear-view mirrors:
choices: You should tap your horn a few times
It is best to reduce your following distance
The driver cannot see you

questions.question: Children 12 years old and under should always ride:
choices: In a front seat
In a seat with an active airbag
In a back seat

questions.question: When entering a controlled access highway:
choices: Pull into traffic even if the way is not clear
You must yield the right-of-way to vehicles already on the highway
Vehicles on the highway must yield by changing lanes

questions.question: Always signal to other drivers when you:
choices: Speed up on the interstate
Pull away from a curb
Want them to pass

questions.question: When turning left from the lane closest to the center of a street, you should:
choices: Complete the turn in either lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in the right-hand lane of the cross street
Complete the turn in the closest lane going in your direction

questions.question: If many vehicles pass you in the right lane of a multi-lane roadway:
choices: Keep as far left as possible
Slow down
Move into the right lane, if possible

questions.question: When stopping before a left turn, you should turn the front wheels:
choices: To the left
Straight ahead
To the right

questions.question: When passing a bicyclist, you should:
choices: Give them a full lane width
Insist on the right-of-way
Always honk your horn to alert the bicyclist

questions.question: When approaching a stopped school bus with flashing red lights traveling on your side of an undivided highway with two lanes, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop
Pass as quickly as possible

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed uphill, and there is a curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Toward the travel lane
Into the curb
Parallel to, but not touching, the curb

questions.question: If another driver follows you too closely (tailgated), you should:
choices: Move over to the right lane, if possible
Use your horn to alert the driver behind you
Pump your brakes to alert the driver behind you

questions.question: The three-second rule helps a driver know:
choices: How closely to follow another vehicle
How much time it takes to pass
When to turn on headlights

questions.question: Yellow lines separate traffic:
choices: Going in opposite directions
With special permissions
Going in the same direction

questions.question: If you travel through a roundabout and miss your exit, you should:
choices: Back up and exit quickly
Continue around until you reach the exit again
Stop and wait for a gap in the traffic

questions.question: When approaching a stopped emergency vehicle with activated lights on a four-lane roadway, you must:
choices: Try to vacate the lane closest to the emergency vehicle
Avoid looking in the direction of the emergency vehicle
Stay in your lane and keep your speed

questions.question: Why is it dangerous to start your vehicle or warm up the engine in a closed garage?
choices: It is against the law
Your engine is likely to stall
Because of carbon monoxide

questions.question: You should buckle your seat belt and make sure your passengers do too:
choices: Before you drive
Only when you are going on a long trip
When a police officer pulls you over

questions.question: With after-market glass tinting, the front door windows may be darkened up to:
choices: 20 percent
65 percent
0 percent (not allowed)

questions.question: It is a good idea to use your low-beam headlights in the following situations EXCEPT:
choices: When driving in rural areas at night with no other traffic
When driving in fog
When driving night in heavy rain

questions.question: A traffic light with a green arrow indicates that:
choices: All other vehicles and pedestrians have a red light
You can make a safe turn without checking other traffic
Opposing vehicles are stopped by a red light

questions.question: FACT is an abbreviation for:
choices: Fair Access to Credential Tests
First Assessment and Coordination Test
Failure to Appear in Court for Traffic violations

questions.question: When a pedestrian enters a crosswalk at an uncontrolled intersection, you should:
choices: Give the pedestrian the right-of-way
Change lane so you do not have to slow down
Make the pedestrian aware that you are approaching

questions.question: When it is raining or the road is wet, most tires have good traction up to about:
choices: 50 mph
35 mph
60 mph

questions.question: What should you do if you have a traffic crash, and someone is injured?
choices: Call for professional help
Give the person something to drink
Help the person from the car and make the person lie down

questions.question: If a deer suddenly runs in front of your vehicle and a crash is unavoidable, you should:
choices: Brake firmly and not swerve
Keep your speed and blast your horn
Steer to the center of the road

questions.question: What should you do if you suddenly hear a thumping sound from your tires?
choices: Grip the steering wheel firmly, ease off gas and steer straight
Step hard on the brakes
Keep speed and immediately steer off the road

questions.question: If you are stopped by a police officer and cited for a traffic law violation, you should never:
choices: Argue your case in court
Argue your case instead of signing the ticket
Accept the ticket

questions.question: Always signal to other drivers when you plan to:
choices: Use your cell phone
Enter an intersection
Make a stop

questions.question: A Class M driver's license permits a person to drive:
choices: Any single unit vehicle with a gross vehicle weight rating of 26,001 pounds or more
A bus with a seating capacity of 24 passengers or more
A motorcycle or motor tricycle

questions.question: You have a green light, and vehicles are blocking your way into the intersection. What should you do?
choices: Insist on the right-of-way
Proceed slowly
Stay where you are

questions.question: What is the three-second rule?
choices: A rule to calculate your stopping distance
A rule to determine your maximum following distance
A way to measure your safe following distance

questions.question: You are driving a car with a handicapped person placard and license plates. Can you park in a handicapped parking space?
choices: Only if the handicapped person is being transported at the time
Yes, at all times
Only if you park for less than 30 minutes

questions.question: When a traffic officer is directing you to drive against a red light, you must:
choices: Wait for verbal directions
Drive against the red light
Wait until somebody else follows the directions

questions.question: You are following a school bus, and there is a railroad crossing ahead. You must slow down and prepare to stop because the bus:
choices: Needs more space when driving across tracks
Will drive slower when driving across tracks
Must stop at the crossing

questions.question: Which of the following could be signs of aggressive driving?
choices: Signaling well in advance of a turn
Keeping a safe following distance
Cutting people off

questions.question: When you approach a work zone sign:
choices: You must immediately stop and back up
Conditions ahead are less than ideal for driving
You should drive faster to get out of the work zone quicker

questions.question: You should always wear your lap belt:
choices: Very loosely, so you can move freely
Low and snug across the hips
Over your stomach

questions.question: By driving in this state, you have given consent to submit to a test to determine the alcohol or drug content of your blood when requested by:
choices: Court
A law enforcement officer
Missouri Department of Revenue

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you turn at an intersection because:
choices: They always have the right-of-way at intersections
Motorcycles are small and often overlooked by motorists
They are not required to stop at intersections

questions.question: Hydroplaning can happen:
choices: Only when you drive faster than the speed limit
Even when roads are dry
At any speed over 35 mph

questions.question: When are you allowed to pass a school bus?
choices: If the school bus has stopped, and red lights are flashing
If you are signaled by another driver to proceed
If the school bus is in motion

questions.question: When is a good time to adjust your seat and mirrors?
choices: When you stop at a red light
Before you begin to drive
After you start driving

questions.question: If you are involved in a crash with a wild animal, you should:
choices: Report it to a local law enforcement agency
Stop and move the animal to the side of the road
Stop and leave a note with your name and address

questions.question: When driving at night, you should:
choices: Turn on your interior light
Always keep your eyes focused straight ahead
Use more safety margins

questions.question: Signaling when suddenly slowing down or stopping is:
choices: Required by law
Required by law only in business districts, cities, and towns
Common courtesy but not required by law

questions.question: When measured at the highest point above the ground, bumpers on passenger vehicles may not exceed:
choices: 22 inches
32 inches
12 inches

questions.question: When making a left turn, you should:
choices: Signal at least 100 feet before the turn
Turn as soon as possible and try to cut the corner
While waiting to turn, keep your wheels pointed to the left

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
choices: Passing is not allowed in either direction
Passing is allowed if the broken line is on your side
Passing on the left is permitted in either direction

questions.question: If a traffic signal light is not working, you:
choices: Must always stop
May proceed without stopping if you reach the intersection first
May proceed without stopping if way is clear

questions.question: Using the right shoulder to pass another vehicle is:
choices: Allowed if the other vehicle is turning left
Allowed if the other vehicle is going too slowly
Never allowed

questions.question: State laws say:
choices: Nothing about the right-of-way
Who always has the right-of-way
Who must yield the right-of-way
